intro: Vallea glabra, commonly known as the smooth valley herb, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name.
